metadata.title: Channel Benchmarks & Paid Acquisition Playbook — Intus Ecommerce Supplement

rawMarkdown:
# Channel Benchmarks & Paid Acquisition Playbook — Intus Ecommerce Supplement
**Supplements:** Deliverable 13 (Ad Creative Testing Framework)
**Department:** Distribution & Growth Engine
**Intelligence Source:** Ecommerce Acquisition Notebook (2025 benchmarks)
**Date:** February 2026

---

## Why This Supplement Exists

Deliverable 13 built a strong 3-phase testing framework (Pre-Flight → New vs. BAU → Scaling) with clear decision rules and creative concepts. However, it lacked 2025 channel-specific benchmarks — what does "good" look like on Meta vs. TikTok vs. Google for DTC activewear? When should you switch from first-purchase to LTV bidding? How fast do you need to produce new creative? This supplement provides the benchmarks and channel economics that turn the testing framework into a calibrated acquisition machine.

---

## 1. The 2025 Paid Acquisition Landscape

### What's Changed Since the Original Deliverable

| Shift | Impact on Intus |
|-------|----------------|
| **AI-powered campaign types dominate** | Meta Advantage+ and Google PMax are now the default. Manual targeting is a fallback, not a strategy. |
| **Creative is the new targeting** | Algorithms go broad. Your ad creative qualifies the audience, not interest targeting. |
| **UGC outperforms studio content** | UGC in Facebook ads delivers 4x higher CTR and 50% lower CPC than standard creative |
| **Signal quality determines success** | Without server-side tracking (CAPI), you're flying blind. Pixel-only data loses 30-40% of conversions. |
| **Agentic commerce is emerging** | 23% of Americans have made AI-assisted purchases. Prepare product data for AI agent crawling. |

---

## 2. Channel-Specific Benchmarks

### 2.1 Meta (Instagram + Facebook) — Primary Channel

**Budget allocation (from Deliverable 13):** 50% of paid budget

| Metric | DTC Activewear Benchmark (2025) | Intus Target | Notes |
|--------|--------------------------------|-------------|-------|
| **Prospecting CAC** | $25-40 AUD (fashion category) | <$30 AUD | $30 = break-even at 30% margin on $100 Kit |
| **Retargeting CAC** | $10-20 AUD | <$15 AUD | Warm audiences from Kit Quiz + site visitors |
| **CTR (UGC creative)** | 1.2-1.8% (avg), 4x lift with UGC | >2.0% with UGC | UGC is non-negotiable for Intus (Gen Z trust) |
| **CPC** | 50% lower with UGC vs. standard | Track and optimize | Don't optimize for CPC directly — optimize for CPA |
| **nROAS** | 2-3x prospecting, 5-8x retargeting | >3x blended nROAS | nROAS = New Customer Revenue / Ad Spend |

**Advantage+ Shopping Campaigns (ASC+) Playbook:**

| Setting | Recommendation | Why |
|---------|---------------|-----|
| **Targeting** | Broad (no interest targeting) | ASC+ uses AI to find your audience. Restricting it increases costs. Let the creative qualify the audience. |
| **Creative volume** | 5-10 creatives per campaign | Algorithm needs variation to test. More creative = more signals. |
| **Budget** | Start at $50-100/day, scale 20-30% every 3-4 days | Gradual scaling preserves learning. Sudden jumps reset the algorithm. |
| **Exclusions** | Exclude existing customers from ASC+ | Prevents paying to acquire customers who would've bought anyway. This is the #1 mistake. |
| **Branded search cannibalization** | Run a separate manual campaign for retargeting | ASC+ should be purely new customer acquisition |

**Creative performance hierarchy for Intus:**

| Creative Type | Expected Performance | Use Case |
|--------------|---------------------|----------|
| **UGC testimonial** (direct-to-camera) | Highest CTR, lowest CPC | "I wore this Kit for 12 hours straight" — real customer, real day |
| **Day-in-the-life video** | High engagement, strong brand lift | POV transition content (studio → coffee → evening) |
| **Product showcase with context** | Reliable CPA, consistent ROAS | Kit photography in lifestyle setting (not white background) |
| **Text-forward/typography** | Lower engagement, higher qualified clicks | "Your day is 24 hours. Your workout is 1." — filters for intent |

### 2.2 TikTok — Discovery Channel

**Budget allocation (from Deliverable 13):** 30% of paid budget

| Metric | DTC Benchmark (2025) | Intus Target | Notes |
|--------|---------------------|-------------|-------|
| **Prospecting CAC** | $30-50 AUD (higher cold traffic cost) | <$45 AUD | TikTok has higher CPMs but lower funnel intent. Accept higher CAC for brand building. |
| **Creative refresh cycle** | Every 2-3 weeks (faster than Meta) | 2-week refresh minimum | TikTok audiences fatigue faster. Format: native, not polished. |
| **Hook rate** | 30%+ (% who watch past 3 seconds) | >35% | "What do you do between workouts?" = strong hook |

**TikTok-specific strategy:**

| Tactic | Implementation |
|--------|---------------|
| **Creative velocity** | 5-7 new concepts per week across platforms (AI-assisted research + production). Top brands maintain this cadence. 85.7% of DTC advertisers already use AI for creative research. |
| **TikTok Shop** | Enable TikTok Shop when available in AU. In-platform checkout reduces friction. Fashion brands seeing strong early results. |
| **Spark Ads** | Boost organic UGC posts as ads. Preserves authenticity. Lower CPMs than standard ads. |
| **Creator partnerships** | Partner with 3-5 micro-creators (10K-100K followers) in fitness/lifestyle. Creator content as ads outperforms brand content. |
| **Content style** | Phone-shot, talking-to-camera, "day with me" format. Do NOT run polished Meta ads on TikTok. |

**Decision: When to increase TikTok budget:**
- If TikTok-sourced customers show higher LTV (check after 90 days)
- If branded search volume increases when TikTok spend increases (halo effect)
- If creative costs are lower on TikTok (UGC creators vs. professional shoots)

### 2.3 Google (Shopping + PMax) — Intent Channel

**Budget allocation (from Deliverable 13):** Not originally allocated (YouTube at 10% only)

**Recommendation:** Add Google Shopping at 10% of budget (take from testing reserve or scale overall budget)

| Metric | DTC Benchmark (2025) | Intus Target | Notes |
|--------|---------------------|-------------|-------|
| **Non-branded CAC** | $20-35 AUD | <$25 AUD | High-intent searchers ("reformer pilates leggings") |
| **Branded CAC** | $3-8 AUD | Track but don't celebrate | These customers were already looking for you |
| **Search conversion rate** | 2-5% (non-branded), 8-15% (branded) | >3% non-branded | Organic search converts 13% better than AI referrals |

**Google PMax critical rule:**

> **Exclude branded search terms from Performance Max campaigns.**

PMax will eagerly spend budget on branded searches (people already searching "Intus activewear") and report inflated ROAS. This is not incremental — these customers would have found you anyway. Run branded search as a separate manual campaign with minimal budget.

**Google Shopping feed optimization for Intus:**

| Field | Optimization |
|-------|-------------|
| **Product title** | "[Kit Name] — [Key Benefit] | Intus" e.g., "The Reformer Kit — Activewear for Your Full Day | Intus" |
| **Description** | Lead with benefit, not features. "One outfit from studio to street." |
| **Images** | Lifestyle image primary (Kit on person), not white background |
| **Product type** | Activewear > Sets > [Kit Name] (specific categorization for algorithm) |
| **Custom labels** | Kit vs. Individual, Price tier, New vs. Evergreen |

### 2.4 Emerging Channels to Test (Month 3+)

Only test after Meta + TikTok + Google are profitable and scaling.

| Channel | Budget | When to Test | Why |
|---------|--------|-------------|-----|
| **YouTube Shorts ads** | 5% | Month 3 | Repurpose TikTok/Reels content. Growing audience. Bridge between social discovery and search intent. |
| **AppLovin** | 5% | Month 4 | High reach, affordable CPMs compared to Meta. Gaining DTC traction. |
| **Connected TV (CTV)** | Test only | Month 6+ | Growing +13.8% in 2025. Requires higher production value. Better for brand building than direct response. |
| **Agentic Commerce prep** | $0 (operational) | Now | Ensure product data is structured for AI agents (clean titles, descriptions, schema markup). 23% of Americans already using AI for purchases. By 2030: 10-20% of US ecommerce. |

---

## 3. First-Purchase vs. LTV-Optimized Bidding

### 3.1 The Shift

| Phase | Bidding Strategy | When |
|-------|-----------------|------|
| **Month 1-3** (Launch) | First-purchase optimized | Optimize for purchase conversions. Goal: build pixel data, find winning creative, establish CAC baseline. |
| **Month 4-6** (Growth) | Hybrid | Run first-purchase campaigns for prospecting + value-based bidding for retargeting. Start feeding LTV data to platforms. |
| **Month 7+** (Scale) | LTV-optimized | Optimize for high-value customers, not just any purchase. Platforms need 50+ conversions/week minimum for LTV bidding to work. |

### 3.2 Why This Matters for Intus

| Customer Type | First Purchase | Conversion Rate | Repeat Rate |
|---------------|---------------|-----------------|-------------|
| **New prospect** | $100 Kit | 5-20% | Unknown |
| **Loyal customer** | $100+ (Kit + Layer) | 60-70% | Predictable |

Loyal customers convert at 60-70% vs. 5-20% for new prospects. Once you have 90 days of data, shift budget toward acquiring customers who look like your best repeat buyers — not just anyone who'll buy once.

### 3.3 LTV Data Pipeline

| Step | Implementation | Timeline |
|------|---------------|----------|
| 1. Track repeat purchases | Klaviyo + Shopify cohort reports | Month 1 (start tracking immediately) |
| 2. Calculate LTV by acquisition source | Which channel brings the highest-LTV customers? | Month 3 (need 90 days of data) |
| 3. Feed LTV data to Meta | Custom conversion values in CAPI (e.g., "high-value customer" = $300 LTV) | Month 4 |
| 4. Switch to value-based bidding | Tell Meta to optimize for $300 LTV customers, not just any $100 purchase | Month 6 |

### 3.4 LTV Economics for Intus

| Metric | Target | Benchmark |
|--------|--------|-----------|
| **LTV:CAC ratio** | >3:1 minimum, 5:1 excellent | <2:1 is unsustainable (burning cash). >5:1 means under-investing. |
| **CAC payback period** | <3 months | Healthy: 3-6 months. Elite: first-order profitable. Warning: >12 months. |
| **Second purchase timing** | 60-90 days | Average for activewear. Post-purchase flow (Deliverable 12) targets Day 30 cross-sell. |
| **12-month LTV** | $200-300 (2-3 purchases) | Driven by Kit expansion (new Kits, Layers, accessories) |

---

## 4. Creative Velocity Requirements

### 4.1 The New Reality

In 2025, creative is the primary targeting lever. Algorithms go broad — your ad creative is what qualifies the audience. This means you need a production machine, not a production schedule.

| Metric | Target | Why |
|--------|--------|-----|
| **New concepts per week** | 5-7 across all platforms | Top DTC brands maintain this cadence. Creative fatigue is the #1 performance killer. |
| **Creative refresh cycle** | 2-3 weeks per platform | TikTok fatigues fastest (2 weeks), Meta lasts slightly longer (3-4 weeks as per Deliverable 13) |
| **Active creatives per scaling campaign** | 3-5 minimum | Never rely on a single ad. Diversity protects against fatigue spikes. |
| **AI assistance** | Mandatory | 85.7% of DTC advertisers use AI for creative research, 78.6% for production |

### 4.2 Creative Production System for Intus

**Monthly output target: 20-28 new creative assets**

| Source | Volume | Cost | Quality |
|--------|--------|------|---------|
| **UGC from customers** | 5-10/month (from #MyIntusKit, review photos) | Free (incentivized by post-purchase flow) | Highest trust, lowest production value — perfect for TikTok/Reels |
| **Creator partnerships** | 5-8/month (3-5 micro-creators) | $200-500/creator/month | Authentic voice, professional quality, platform-native |
| **Internal production** | 5-10/month (phone-shot, founder content) | Staff time only | Brand storytelling, behind-the-scenes, transition POVs |
| **AI-generated variations** | Unlimited (copy variants, hook tests) | Tool subscription ($50-100/month) | A/B test hooks, CTAs, and copy angles at scale |

### 4.3 Creative Brief Template (for creators)

For each concept, provide:

```
CONCEPT: [Name]
HOOK (first 3 seconds): [The line/visual that stops the scroll]
BODY (10-20 seconds): [The narrative or demonstration]
CTA (final 3-5 seconds): [Action + offer]
PLATFORM: [TikTok / Meta / Both]
ARCHETYPE: [Magician / Sage]
DO: [Transition moments, real life, UGC-style]
DON'T: [Gym interiors, discounts, "Shop Now" CTA, polished studio]
```

---

## 5. Signal Quality & Server-Side Tracking

### 5.1 Why This Is Critical

Without proper signal quality, your platforms are bidding blind. After iOS14, browser-based pixels lose 30-40% of conversion data.

| Implementation | Status | Priority |
|---------------|--------|----------|
| **Meta Conversions API (CAPI)** | REQUIRED | Critical — without this, Meta can't optimize properly |
| **Google Enhanced Conversions** | REQUIRED | Critical — feeds accurate data to PMax |
| **TikTok Events API** | REQUIRED | High — same signal loss problem as Meta |
| **Shopify server-side events** | REQUIRED | Foundation — Shopify → GA4 via Measurement Protocol |
| **First-party data collection** | Ongoing | Essential — 92% of brands call first-party data "essential" in 2025 |

### 5.2 Implementation Priority

1. **Week 1:** Enable Shopify server-side tracking → GA4 Measurement Protocol
2. **Week 1:** Set up Meta CAPI through Shopify's native integration
3. **Week 2:** Enable Google Enhanced Conversions in Shopify
4. **Week 2:** Set up TikTok Events API
5. **Week 3:** Validate data accuracy (server-side should match Shopify orders within 90%)

---

## 6. Updated Budget Allocation (Revised from Deliverable 13)

### Launch Month (Month 1): $2,500-3,500 AUD

| Channel | % | Budget | Purpose |
|---------|---|--------|---------|
| **Meta (IG + FB)** | 45% | $1,125-1,575 | ASC+ prospecting + manual retargeting. Kit Quiz traffic. |
| **TikTok** | 25% | $625-875 | Discovery + Spark Ads. UGC amplification. |
| **Google Shopping** | 15% | $375-525 | Non-branded product searches. High-intent capture. |
| **Testing reserve** | 15% | $375-525 | Phase 1 Pre-Flight, Runoff testing, emerging channel tests. |

### Growth Phase (Month 3-6): $5,000-8,000 AUD

| Channel | % | Budget | Purpose |
|---------|---|--------|---------|
| **Meta** | 40% | $2,000-3,200 | Scale winners. Value-based bidding (Month 4+). |
| **TikTok** | 25% | $1,250-2,000 | Scale + TikTok Shop (when available). |
| **Google** | 20% | $1,000-1,600 | Shopping + non-branded search expansion. |
| **YouTube Shorts** | 5% | $250-400 | Repurposed creative testing. |
| **Testing/Emerging** | 10% | $500-800 | AppLovin test, CTV test. |

---

## 7. Decision Framework: When to Scale vs. Pull Back

| Signal | Action |
|--------|--------|
| nROAS >3x for 7+ consecutive days | Scale budget 20-30% |
| CAC <$30 and stable for 2 weeks | Scale budget, expand to new audiences |
| CAC rising >30% for 3+ days | Rotate creative first. If CAC doesn't drop, reduce budget. |
| CTR declining 3+ days | Creative fatigue. Launch new Pre-Flight batch. |
| Branded search volume increasing while TikTok spend increases | TikTok halo effect confirmed. Don't cut TikTok based on last-click attribution. |
| nROAS <2x for 2+ weeks | Channel economics don't work. Reallocate to higher-performing channel. |

---

*Supplement S03 of 5 — Intus Ecommerce Intelligence Layer*
*Supplements Deliverable 13: Ad Creative Testing Framework*
